    • Constructor Detail

      • Rule

        public Rule(org.openrdf.model.URI id,
            boolean fixpoint,
            int phase,
            @Nullable
            org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr deleteExpr,
            @Nullable
            org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr insertExpr,
            @Nullable
            org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr whereExpr)
        Creates a new rule.
        Parameters:
        id - the rule ID, not null
        fixpoint - true, if the rule should be evaluated with a fixpoint semantics
        phase - the evaluation phase associated to this rule (defaults to zero)
        deleteExpr - the optional DELETE expression; if present, must be a BGP
        insertExpr - the optional INSERT expression; if present, must be a BGP
        whereExpr - the optional WHERE expression (absent in case of rules asserting axiomatic quads)

    • Method Detail

      • getID

        public org.openrdf.model.URI getID()
        Returns the rule ID.
        Returns:
        the rule ID

      • isFixpoint

        public boolean isFixpoint()
        Returns true if the rule must be evaluated using a fixpoint semantics
        Returns:
        true, for fixpoint rules

      • getPhase

        public int getPhase()
        Returns the evaluation phase this rule is associated to. Evaluation phases with lower index are executed first.
        Returns:
        an integer (possibly negative) identifying the evaluation phase.

      • getDeleteExpr

        @Nullable
public org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr getDeleteExpr()
        Returns the optional DELETE expression
        Returns:
        the DELETE expression if present, null otherwise

        Returns:

        @Nullable
public org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr getWhereExpr()

        Returns:
        the WHERE expression if present; null otherwise

      • getDeletePatterns

        public Set<org.openrdf.query.algebra.StatementPattern> getDeletePatterns()
        Returns the statement patterns in the DELETE expression, if any.
        Returns:
        a non-null set with the statement patterns in the DELETE expression

      • getInsertPatterns

        public Set<org.openrdf.query.algebra.StatementPattern> getInsertPatterns()
        Returns the statement patterns in the INSERT expression, if any.
        Returns:
        a non-null set with the statement patterns in the INSERT expression

      • getWherePatterns

        public Set<org.openrdf.query.algebra.StatementPattern> getWherePatterns()
        Returns the statement patterns in the WHERE expression, if any.
        Returns:
        a non-null set with the statement patterns in the WHERE expression

      • getCommonVariables

        public List<String> getCommonVariables()
        Returns a sorted list with the variables returned by the WHERE expression that are referenced either in the DELETE or in the INSERT expressions.
        Returns:
        a sorted list of common variables between the WHERE expression and the DELETE and INSERT expressions

      • isSafe

        public boolean isSafe()
        Returns true if the rule is safe, i.e., if all the variables referenced in the DELETE and INSERT expressions are present in the bindings produced by the WHERE expression. Only safe rules can be evaluated. Non-safe rules are however allowed as they can be transformed into safe rules through variable binding (by calling method rewriteVariables(BindingSet)).
        Returns:
        true, if the rule is safe

      • isSimple

        public boolean isSimple()
        Returns true if the rule is simple, i.e., if the WHERE expression consists only of BGPs, FILTERs (without the EXISTS construct) and outer level BINDs. Simple rules can be evaluated more efficiently.
        Returns:
        true, if the rule is simple

      • isStreamable

        public boolean isStreamable()
        Returns true if the rule can be evaluated in a streaming way. A rule is streamable if: (i) it is simple (see isSimple()); (ii) its where part contains at most one statement pattern; and (iii) the delete part is missing or it contains exactly the statement pattern of the where part (which must be non empty).
        Returns:
        true, if the rule is streamable

      • isSpecific

        public boolean isSpecific()
        Returns true if the rule matches only specific types of statements. A rule is specific if its where part is null or it does not contain a statement pattern that could match any statement. Specific rules might be evaluated only on a subset of statements (the ones that could be matched) obtaining the same results.
        Returns:
        true, if the rule is specific

      • mightActivate

        public boolean mightActivate(org.openrdf.query.algebra.evaluation.impl.EvaluationStatistics statistics)
        Returns true if the rule may be activated given the dataset statistics supplied. Note that false positive answers may be returned, i.e, if the result is true it is not guaranteed that the rule will fire, whereas if the result is false the rule is guaranteed not to fire (under the assumption that statistics returned by statisitcs are 0.0 only if no triple is returned for a certain statement pattern).
        Parameters:
        statistics - the statistics object
        Returns:
        true, if the rule might fire given the supplied statistics

      • rewriteGlobalGM

        public Rule rewriteGlobalGM(@Nullable
                            org.openrdf.model.URI globalGraph)
        Rewrites the rule according to the GLOBAL graph inference mode, using the global graph URI specified. The returned rule: (i) has a new ID generated based on the ID of this rule; (ii) matches quads in any graph in the WHERE part; (iii) insert quads in the specified global graph; and (iv) deletes quads from any graph.
        Parameters:
        globalGraph - the URI of the global graph where to insert new quads; if null, quads will be inserted in the default graph sesame:nil
        Returns:
        the rewritten rule

      • rewriteSeparateGM

        public Rule rewriteSeparateGM()
        Rewrites the rule according to the SEPARATE graph inference mode. The returned rule: (i) has a new ID generated based on the ID of this rule; and (ii) operates on a per-graph basis, i.e., for each graph, the WHERE clause is applied and its results are used to evaluate the DELETE and INSERT clauses on the very same graph.
        Returns:
        the rewritten rule

      • rewriteStarGM

        public Rule rewriteStarGM(@Nullable
                          org.openrdf.model.URI globalGraph)
        Rewrites the rule according to the STAR graph inference mode, using the global graph URI supplied. The returned rule: (i) has a new ID generated based on the ID of this rule; (ii) operates on a per-graph basis similarly to rewriteSeparateGM(), however 'importing' (as far as matching in the WHERE clause is concerned) also quads in the global graph; and (iii) in case the WHERE clause is missing or a match is found on quads in the global graph, deletions and insertions are performed on the global graph itself (this can be useful to setup the global graph 'before' applying rules on the other graphs)
        Parameters:
        globalGraph - the URI of the global graph whose quads are 'imported' in other graphs; if null, the default graph sesame:nil will be used
        Returns:
        the rewritten rule

      • rewriteVariables

        public Rule rewriteVariables(@Nullable
                             org.openrdf.query.BindingSet bindings)
        Rewrites the rule by replacing selected variables with constant values as dictated by the supplied bindings. In case the rewriting is unnecessary this rule is returned unchanged; otherwise, a new, rewritten rule with a different ID (based on the ID of this rule) is produced.
        Parameters:
        bindings - the variable = value bindings to use for the rewriting; if null or empty, no rewriting will take place
        Returns:
        either the rewritten rule of this rule, if rewriting is unnecessary

      • mergeSameWhereExpr

        public static List<Rule> mergeSameWhereExpr(Iterable<Rule> rules)
        Merges rules with the same WHERE expression, priority and fixpoint flag. A merged rule, with a fresh ID, is produced for each cluster of rules having the same values of these attributes. The DELETE and INSERT expressions of the merged rule are obtained by concatenating the DELETE and INSERT expressions of the rules in the cluster.
        Parameters:
        rules - the rules to merge
        Returns:
        a list with the merged rules

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate(QuadModel model,
                     @Nullable
                     QuadModel deltaModel,
                     @Nullable
                     org.openrdf.query.algebra.StatementPattern deltaPattern,
                     @Nullable
                     Supplier<org.openrdf.rio.RDFHandler> deleteSink,
                     @Nullable
                     Supplier<org.openrdf.rio.RDFHandler> insertSink)

        public static int evaluate(Iterable<Rule> rules,
                           QuadModel model,
                           @Nullable
                           QuadModel deltaModel,
                           @Nullable
                           Supplier<org.openrdf.rio.RDFHandler> deleteSink,
                           @Nullable
                           Supplier<org.openrdf.rio.RDFHandler> insertSink)

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Rule other)
        Rules with the same ID are equal. Otherwise, rules are sorted by phase (lower phase index comes first), fixpoint flag (false = no fixpoint comes first) and finally ID. This sorting is compatible with the order of execution of rules.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<Rule>

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object object)
        Two rules are equal if they have the same ID.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        The returned hash code depends exclusively on the rule ID.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • toString

        public String toString()
        The returned string has the form ID (phase: N, fixpoint): DELETE ... INSERT ... WHERE ..., where the fixpoint, DELETE ..., INSERT ... and WHERE ... may be present or absent based on the properties of the rule.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • toRDF

        public <T extends Collection<? super org.openrdf.model.Statement>> T toRDF(T output)
        Emits the RDF serialization of the rule. Emitted triples are placed in the default graph.
        Parameters:
        output - the collection where to add emitted RDF statements, not null
        Returns:
        the supplied collection

      • fromDLOG

                           throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • fromRDF

        public static List<Rule> fromRDF(Iterable<org.openrdf.model.Statement> model)
        Parses all the rules contained in the supplied RDF statements.
        Parameters:
        model - the RDF statements, not null
        Returns:
        an unsorted list containing the parsed rules
